Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_EN1_1}Varagos
Settlement.text: {=3u1Zy671}Varagos sits on the Aris River, which flows into the deep pool known as the Ophthys. Landowners here have planted mulberry bushes on the warm hillsides, on which they cultivate silkworms.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_EN2_1}Lochana
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_EN2_1}Lochana is named for a castle that guards the Carcasos river. Along with Epinosa, its twin on the opposite bank, it forms the centuries-old border defense of this far-flung corner of empire against raiders from the north. The nearby sea tempers the cold of the northern winters here, allowing the cultivation of mulberry bushes for silk.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_EN3_1}Rhesos
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_EN3_1}Rhesos sits amid the jumbled ridges of the Lesser Dryatic Mountains. Highland cattle thrive on the grasses of the heights.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_EN4_1}Gaos
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_EN4_1}Gaos sits in a broad valley in the Myzead, the rugged highlands in the east of the Empire. Nomadic herders once occupied this land, and the village's name is taken from their word for cattle.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_EN5_1}Atrion
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_EN5_1}Atrion lies by the delta of the Nevys, a cold, slow-moving river that drains into Lake Laconis. The land here was mostly marsh until a well-financed consortium of imperial gentry built dykes to reclaim it. Today they cultivate mulberry bushes, used to produce silk.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_EN6_1}Ataconia
Settlement.text: {=94c5GMQr}Ataconia sits near the headwaters of the Aris river in the piedmont of the Dryatic Mountains. The hills, rich with oak trees, are ideal for the raising of acorn-eating swine.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_EN7_1}Epinosa
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_EN7_1}Epinosa sits on a tongue of land surrounded by rivers, the names of which reflect the long history of trade and conflict in this vital crossroads. The northern branch is known as the Caracasos, a name which derives from the Sturgian Karakaz, which itself derives from a Khuzait language. The Nords know it as the Jumne, a word derived from the Sturgian word for barrow. The southern branch is known to all the peoples of this region as the Davuna. The villagers here raise cattle on the thick grass of the riverside marches.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_EN7_2}Pons
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_EN7_2}Pons was named for a bridge across the Caracasos River, though that was washed out generations ago in a flood and replaced by other crossings both upstream and downstream. The locals mine deposits of salt from nearby hills.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_EN8_1}Syratos
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_EN8_1}Syratos sits at the the base of Mount Tarnea, west of Lake Tanaesis. Flax grows well here, in the cold damp valley floor.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_EN8_2}Tememos
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_EN8_2}Tememos lies where the Plain of Ichala rises to meet the highlands of the Myzead. Horses graze on the mountain slopes in the summers and are taken to the valley floor when grasses sproud there after the winter rains.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_EN9_1}Mecalovea
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_EN9_1}Mecalovea sits on a rocky shelf of the Dryatic Mountains, surrounded on three sides by the Miron River and its tributary streams. This site affords it some protection from the raiders and brigands who plague this frontier region. The fast-flowing water has cut through the rock to expose rich seams of iron ore.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_EN9_2}Agalmon
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_EN9_2}Agalmon sits in a valley in the Dryatic Mountains. The soil here is rich for a highland region, and the villagers have learned how to use terracing and other techniques to coax grain out of the mountain soil.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_EN1}Epicrotea
Settlement.text: {=n9WMUuSp}Epicrotea, the 'All-Conquering' was named after the eccentric long-haired military genius Sarapios, who crushed a Battanian host and secured the lands west of Lake Laconis for the Empire. Its towers, overlooking the Miron river, have frequently been a northerner's first glimpse of the awesome and terrible force to their south.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_EN1_1}Marathea
Settlement.text: {=YHbN2pKZ}Marathea lies in a valley in the Dryatic Mountains, overlooking Lake Laconis. The villagers are skilled miners, and the red streaks running down the nearby cliffsides are evidence of rich iron ores.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_EN1_2}Stathymos
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_EN1_2}Stathymos lies by a tributary of the Miron River, north of the Dryatic Mountains. The nearby hills have several hot springs, whose faint whiff of sulfur has made Stathymos one of several villages in the Empire who claim to have once been plagued by dragons who were eventually slain by bold cataphracts.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_EN1_3}Gymos
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_EN1_3}Gymos is a quiet fishing village in the Diathmic Bay, on the far west of Lake Laconis. Villagers harvest pike from the bay's deep waters.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_EN3_2}Dyopalis
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_EN1_4}Dyopalis lies in a valley in the Lesser Dryatic Mountains. Despite the cold winters, the region's fertile soils make this district one of the breadbaskets of the northern Empire.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_EN2}Diathma
Settlement.text: {=wKMo2CUP}Diathma, the city of the Divine Decree, was erected by an imperial general on the ruins of a Dryatic shrine overlooking Lake Laconis. It was the last stand of the Dryatics, the northernmost of the Palaic peoples, who rebelled against the Empire and were overcome. According to legend they were pushed back into the shallows of the lake and fought until they were exhausted and the bloody waters engulfed them.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_EN2_1}Alosea
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_EN2_1}Alosea lies on the southern shores of Lake Laconis. The folk of this region live well off the pike and sturgeon of the lake.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_EN2_2}Jeracos
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_EN2_2}Jeracos sits in meadowland in the northern piedmont of the Dryatic Mountains. The slopes of the nearby hills are pierced with mineshafts. Despite centuries of use, they still yield ores from which silver can be extracted through various cunning techniques.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_EN5_2}Masangara
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_EN2_3}Masangara sits on the banks of the Nevys, a cold, slow-moving river that empties into Lake Laconis. Cattle are raised here in former marshy woodlands, now drained and turned into meadows.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_EN3}Saneopa
Settlement.text: {=EJZLzhJk}Saneopa sits on a low pass leading from the Nevys valley to the north to the pool of the Ophthys. The ancient Palaic peoples of this region, like the Battanians, treated lakes as sacred sites, and the Ophthys in particular was said to be a gateway to another world. The hustle and bustle of Saneopa, one of the main trading centers of inland Calradia, stands in sharp contrast to the dark and silent waters below.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_EN3_1}Enoisa
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_EN3_1}Enoisa sits by the cold, slow-moving River Nevys as it makes its way towards Lake Laconis. Wheat grows here, fed by the ample rains of the north.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_EN1_2}Aeoria
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_EN3_2}Aeoria sits in the fertile Vale of the Aris, where the river winds between parallel granite ridges. The dialect here is laced with words from Palaic, the language spoken in the center of the continent before the Empire came.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_EN3_3}Crios
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_EN3_3}Crios sits besides the River Aris as it descends into the Ophthys, the dark pool that lies at the foot of Mount Tarnea. Shrines built by the ancient Palaic people, who believed the lake was a gateway to another worgendsd, can be found along its shores.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_EN4}Argoron
Settlement.text: {=LqPJY4s9}The city of Argoron sits where the cold, slow moving Nevys River meets Lake Laconis. This was once the land of the Laconians, who saw the Empire as a protector against the more warlike Palaic peoples. They welcomed and intermarried with imperial settlers and their chiefs joined the Senate, and their old language and customs faded away.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_EN6_2}Potamis
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_EN4_1}Potamis sits at the edge of the Temea Valley, near the foothills of the Dryatic Mountains. The people of these parts have raised cattle since pre-Calradic times, and its milk and butter are sought out by traders and travellers passing through the region.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_EN4_2}Alatys
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_EN4_2}Alatys lies on the flat southern end of Lake Laconis, on delta lowlands formed by the River Nevys. The waters of the lake, which are very shallow and muddy here, are well-stocked with flounder and crayfish, while trout can be fished in the Nevys upstream.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_EN2_2}Nortanisa
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_EN4_3}Nortanisa is a fishing village on the western shores of Lake Laconis. Villagers place nets and cages in the shallow edges of the lake and the nearby estuary of the Caracasos to catch roach, bream, perch, and crayfish.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_EN4_4}Hetania
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_EN4_4}Hetania sits beneath a low ridge in the Lesser Dryatic Mountains. As in many villages around here, the foresters of this region still speak the Dryatic languages of the tribes who lived here before the Empire came.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_EN5}Myzea
Settlement.text: {=8UJ3cPrZ}Myzea gives its name to the Myzead, the mountainous highlands of the eastern Empire. This region is the old stomping grounds of the senator Litos, who brought the Palaic tribes here into the Empire relatively peacefully by offering them protection against raiders from the steppes. When he fell afoul of his rivals in the Senate, however, he tried to organize them into a rival 'barbarian' republic modelled on the ancient Calradian version. The empire snuffed it out, but the people here, now thoroughly Calradicized, still harbor an attachment to the old republican system and its partisans.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_EN5_1}Vealos
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_EN5_1}Vealos sits in a thickly wooded valley in the eastern end of the Myzead, the rugged highlands of the eastern Empire. Retired imperial officers have founded stud farms here, grazing their horses on the rich pasture on the slopes of the heights.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_EN5_2}Orthra
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_EN5_2}Orthra, a relatively recent settlement, was named by an imperial captain for its fine southward views over the Myzead, the mountainous highlands of the eastern empire. It was founded as a stud farm to breed imperial horses with steppe stock from the east, and continues to provide horses for the imperial cavalry.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_EN4_2}Themys
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_EN5_3}Themys lies under a ridge of limestone crags in the Myzead, the mountainous highlands of the eastern Empire. The grasses on the rolling downs are well-suited to the raising of sheep.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_EN5_4}Samatha
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_EN5_4}Samatha sits upon a sloping ridge in the highlands of the Myzead. The hillsides have been terraced to allow the growing of mulberry bushes. The leaves are harvested, placed in vats and fed to silkworms.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_EN6}Amprela
Settlement.text: {=YYYxOiCq}Amprela is the foremost town of the northeastern Empire. Watchmen stand atop its towers, looking out for beacons from the frontier fortresses to the north and east that might signal the approach of enemies. Horse archers recruited from the rough Eleftheroi freemen drink in the barracks, waiting for the order to ride out against Khuzait steppe-riders, Sturgian woodsmen or Nord longships coming down the Caracasos River, while the cataphracts drill in the courtyard of the keep and ensure their horses are in fighting trim should the archon need to assemble an army to deal with any larger threat.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_EN6_1}Avasinton
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_EN6_1}Avasinton sits in a valley of the Myzead, the mountainous highlands of the eastern Empire. Villagers have cleared away the thickets and thornbrush of this region, including the pungent wormwood after which the village is named, to allow the growing of mulberry bushes, the leaves of which are harvested and fed to silkworms.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_EN6_2}Boreagora
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_EN6_2}Boreagora lies where the estuary of the Caracasos River reaches Lake Laconis. The lowlands here are suited to the growing of flax.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_EW1_1}Garontor
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_EW1_1}Garontor gives its name to the straits that join the Gulf of Charas and the inland Perassic Sea, the Gates of Garontor. Coastal meadows, where tall grasses tolerant of the ocean salt-spray thrive, support the rearing of fine horses.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_EW2_1}Thorios
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_EW2_1}Thorios sits in the Temea Valley in the heart of Calradia. Ample rainfall, rich soil and the relatively warm inland climate ensure that the grain fields of this district feed much of the central empire.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_EW2_2}Bergum
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_EW2_2}Bergum sits in the Temea Valley in the heart of Calradia. Rich soil, ample rainfall and the warm inland climate ensure that the grain fields of this district feed much of the central empire.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_EW3_1}Onica
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_EW3_1}Onica lies in the Iltaric Hills, north of the Perassic Sea. The slopes of this district are terraced with vineyards, producing a dry wine popular throughout the Empire.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_EW4_1}Thractorae
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_EW4_1}Thractorae sits on the hills above a small bay that feeds into the larger Gulf of Charas. Oaks grow thick around the streams running down to the sea, allowing hogs to forage acorns and roots.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_EW5_1}Veron
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_EW5_1}Veron lies on the Gavys River, the westernmost tributary of the Aminys. The hills above the town are lined with vineyards which thrive in the well-drained, sandy soil.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_EW5_2}Goleryn
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_EW5_2}Goleryn sits in the warm valley of the Gavys, where the river brushes by an outcrop of the Epiric Hills. Sheep-raising is a way of life in these parts, as is sheep-rustling.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_EW6_1}Hertogea
Settlement.text: {=4awzygJb}Hertogea lies in the shadow of Mount Erithrys. Villagers grow olives on the slopes leading up the mountain. This region is home to a number of hot springs as well as caves that smell of the vapors of the earth. One of them - it is known not which - was home to a Palaic oracle who delivered a series of prophecies about the rise and eventual fall of the Empire. Imperial scholars with a mystical bent hotly debate which of the cryptic verses are authentic, and which ones are later inventions.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_EW7_1}Oristocorys
Settlement.text: {=N8ranMLF}Oristocorys lies on a peninsula west of the Bay of Ortysia. The village sits high on a slope to avoid both mosquitos from coastal marshes and raiding corsairs from the south, but the villagers make their way each morning to the sheltered covers where they keep their boats and set out to catch tuna, swordfish and other large species that migrate through the bay.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_EW7_2}Elvania
Settlement.text: {=Q8OUGbzw}Elvania overlooks the estuary of the Aminys River. Hot southern afternoons and sea-cooled mornings make this good country for wine grapes.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_EW8_1}Gersegos
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_EW8_1}Gersegos sits on a northern spur of the great basalt plutonic slab of Mount Erithrys. Villagers have sunk mines into the cliffs that overlook the village, extracting silver and other precious metals.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_EW1}Lageta
Settlement.text: {=ZAGUIKOn}Lageta was infamously acquired by the Empire by an act of treachery. A rogue imperial mercenary murdered the Palaic chieftain who employed him, took the citadel, invited in imperial colonists, then bequeathed the town to the Empire. The Senate disavowed his action but accepted the bequest. The district is now thoroughly Calradicized, but the Battanians to the north remember, and whenever an imperial envoy speaks of the sanctity of treaties and pacts, they just nod to each other and say, 'Lageta.'

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_EW1_1}Primessos
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_EW1_1}Primessos lies in the wooded upper reaches of the Aminys valley. Pigs, fed on the acorns of the southern oak trees, thrive in this climate.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_EW1_2}Montos
Settlement.text: {=znRLc4v1}Montos sits near the headwaters of the Aminys River, close to the Battanian frontier. The farmers here keep a watchful eye when tending their hillside fields, always looking for raiding parties coming westward from the valley of the Miron River to their east.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_EW6_2}Nideon
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_EW1_3}Nideon sits on a low-lying spit of land where the Gavys, Aminys and Zeos rivers come together. Wine grapes grow on the gentle slopes rising up from the river valley.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_EW2}Zeonica
Settlement.text: {=kghCLS9q}Zeonica sits by the seaside at the base of the Iltaric Hills, a land of wine, grain and horses. It was named for the Lady Zeona, one of the few women to rule the Empire - admittedly as regent for her son rather than Empress Regnant. It is known for the Zeonic Wind, a gale that blows northward across the Perassic Sea every summer carrying the burning heat of the Nahasa desert to the imperial south. In other seasons the weather here is mild, a weather pattern that has provided many a poet with a metaphor for the transience of passion.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_EW3_2}Tarcutis
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_EW2_1}Tarcutis sits on the shores of the Perassic Sea. The sandy soil and morning mists, channeled by offshore islands, allows the growing of grapes overlooking the beaches.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_EW2_2}Neocorys
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_EW2_2}Neocorys, the new village, sits in gently sloping land in the Temea Valley cleared only recently of forest. The local landowners have established stud farms, supplying horses to the imperial cavalry.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_EW2_3}Alsasos
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_EW2_3}Alsasos sits on a shelf of land at the west end of the Temea, a broad valley north of the Perassic sea. Though the climate is relatively dry here, artesian wells allow farmers to grow bountiful crops of wheat.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_EW2_4}Zeocorys
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_EW2_4}Zeocorys lies at the foot of a low escarpment that bisects the Temea Valley. Though the climate is relatively dry here, artesian wells allow farmers to grow bountiful crops of wheat.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_EW3}Jalmarys
Settlement.text: {=TI3fS2xN}Every realm has a city whose inhabitants are mocked for their provincial unsophistication, and for the Empire that city was Jalmarys. One of the first imperial colonies established inland of the Perassic Sea, it served the Empire as a base to subdue the western Palaic tribes. Paravenos was happy to accept the plunder and slaves sent to them from its garrison, but snickered at them behind their backs. That changed when the Jalmaryan general Carsos staged a military coup. When a senator, stymied by his thick accent, nervously asked him to repeat a decree, he unsheathed his sword and said, 'Do you understand this?'

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_EW4_2}Gamardan
Settlement.text: {=FWgBOiaD}Gamardan sits at a key gap in the Epiric Hills, on the route between Charas and the imperial cities of the Aminys valley. The wines of this region are unusually sweet and strong, and valued throughout the Empire.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_EW3_2}Aegosca
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_EW3_2}Aegosca sits at the head of the Temea, a broad valley in southern Calradia. Though originally named for the goats that used to roam this region, the landowners have turned over the pastures to the raising of far more profitable horses.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_EW3_3}Dradios
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_EW3_3}Dradios sits near a bend in the Zeos River. Here the meandering waters have left a rich deposit of silt that sustains one of the breadbaskets of the Empire.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_EW4}Ortysia
Settlement.text: {=JhBSnWAe}Ortysia, named for the quails who inhabit the nearby coastal marshes, was the first Calradian colony on the shores of the Perassic Sea. In its early centuries, it fell under the authority of the Kannic city-state of Quyaz, but the Empire's expansion soon united the colony with its mother republic. For centuries, sailors coming from the pirate-infested islands of the Gulf of Charas gave thanks when they saw its towers looming through the haze of the western Perassic, signalling a return to safe imperial-patrolled waters.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_EW4_1}Arpotis
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_EW4_1}Arpotis lies close to where the Zeos and Gavys rivers join the Aminys and together reach the sea. This well-watered plain is one of the breadbaskets of the Empire.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_EW1_2}Lysia
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_EW4_2}Lysia sits on the promontory above the Gates of Garontor, the straits that link the Gulf of Charas with the Perassic. Salt is farmed from evaporation pans on the broad beaches that look out onto the gulf.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_EW4_3}Vinela
Settlement.text: {=5zqChoOb}Vinela on the landward side of the Epiric Hills, facing the Gavys River. Early morning sea-mists that come up the Gavys valley from the Perassic, together with the hot sun of midday, allow the growing of wine grapes.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_EW4_4}Garengolia
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_EW4_4}Garengolia lies near a rich vein of silver in the eastern end of the Epiric Hills. The Empire have minted its denars from these mines for centuries.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_EW5}Amitatys
Settlement.text: {=rX8oGVvV}The Palaic chieftain of Amitatys had a particularly grim reputation, a tyrant who slaughtered innocents to appease the gods of the underworld in the hope they would grant him immortality. Inevitably, he fell into conflict with the Empire, and during the siege an earthquake crumbled his walls and allowed imperial troops into the city. More died in the ensuing sack than the tyrant had ever killed, but it was war, and the outcome - attributed to the wrath of Heaven - was a staple of imperial propaganda as they expanded their foothold in the region.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_EW5_1}Elipa
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_EW5_1}Elipa sits on the heights overlooking the Plain of Ichala, a sparsely populated ancient lake bed. The plain itself is dry and the soil saline, and is mostly empty grass and scrubland, but the heights above are fertile and receives ample rains.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_EW5_2}Phasos
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_EW5_2}Phasos sits amid rolling chalk uplands on the edge of the Temea Valley. The rich grass of the down is some of the best horse-breeding land in the Empire.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_EW6}Rhotae
Settlement.text: {=5SpYVtie}Rhotae is a former Palaic hill-fort in the shadow of the basalt slab of Mount Erithrys, once known as Rotash. It fell to the Empire shortly afer Lageta. The Palaic chief here, when he heard of what happened to his neighbor, slaughtered a dozen imperial citizens under his protection. The eccentric long-haired general Sarapios led the punitive column that took Rotash and burned it to the ground. 'Lageta we took treacherously but with little bloodshed. Rotash we took honorably, with great bloodshed,' he supposedly said afterwards. 'Both will be remembered as a stain on our name. The victor always takes the blame, but keeps the gold.'

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_EW6_1}Carphenion
Settlement.text: {=bIhsm825}Carphenion lies in the rolling hills east of Mount Erithrys. On summer nights the hills above the village are dotted with the fires of cattle herders, taking their animals to graze on the upland pastures.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_EW8_2}Vathea
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_EW6_2}Vathea sits high on the slopes of the Dryatic Mountains, facing across the valley to the great basalt slab of Mount Erithrys. The villagers mine iron from shafts sunk deep into the cliffs of the mountains.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_EW6_3}Thersenion
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_EW6_3}Thersenion lies in the shadow of Mount Erithrys, a great basalt slab thrust up from the depths of the earth. The Gavys, Aminys amd Zeos rivers all come together in the plains beneath the mountain, making these lands one of the grain breadbaskets of the Empire.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_EW6_4}Leblenion
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_EW6_4}Leblenion sits in the rolling hills of the Temea Valley east of Mount Erithrys, a great basalt slab thrust up from the depths of the earth. This warm land is one of the grain breadbaskets of the Empire.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_ES1_1}Odrysa
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_ES1_1}Odrysa lies near the Aserai frontier at the Calsean Gates, where the hills come down almost to the sea. The boulders here are covered with thousands of years of graffiti, in Calradic, in Nahasawi, Darshi, Kannic and a dozen other languages, from conquerors' triumphant declarations to their soldiers' homesick complaints. Though this area is dry, cedars and other trees grow in gorges in the hills, sustaining a small lumber industry.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_ES2_1}Corenia
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_ES2_1}Corenia is one of the farthest flung villages of the Empire to speak the Calradic tongue. It lies in the north of the Tanaetic Plain, on the shores of Lake Tanaesis. Villagers grow grain here, keeping watch for raiders from across the frontiers.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_ES2_2}Metachia
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_ES2_2}Metachia lies on the southern shores of Lake Tanaesis, where the coastal plain begins to climb towards the ridges of the Myzead. This imperial colony, established in more peaceful times, is a center for mulberry bushes used in silk production.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_ES3_1}Melion
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_ES3_1}Melion sits in a narrow valley near the center of the Myzead, the rugged highlands in the east of the Empire. Villagers here cultivate mulberry bushes. The leaves are harvested and fed to silkworks, producing thread much valued by both refined imperial nobles for their courtwear and hard-riding nomads and frontiersmen, who wear it beneath their armor as an extra layer of protection against arrows.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_ES3_2}Sagolina
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_ES3_2}Sagolina sits at the foot of a narrow valley at the southern end of the Myzead, the rugged highlands of eastern Calradia. Villagers mine salt from deposits in the hills.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_ES4_1}Lavenia
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_ES4_1}Lavenia sits on the northeastern shores of the Perassic. The people of this region sustain themselves by fishing, but also by serving on merchant vessels that haul cargos across the great inland sea, the imperial fleets that protect them, or the corsairs that prey on them.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_ES4_2}Ethemisa
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_ES4_2}Ethemisa lies in a low valley in the Thymian Hills. This region was once barren and mostly deserted, save for the hermits and visionaries who made their homes in its limestone caves. Ethemisa was home to some of the first permanent migrants, who tapped wells on the valley floor to irrigate their fields. According to legend, they demanded that one of the holy recluses here serve as their leader and guide them to virtue. At first he refused, but Heaven sent a flock of goats to follow him everywhere, disturbing his solitude, until he at least repented.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_ES5_1}Morenia
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_ES5_1}Morenia sits overlooking the Sethys River. Villagers collect clay from the riverbanks for the kilns of the imperial southlands.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_ES6_1}Sestadaim
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_ES6_1}Sestadaim sits on the western side of the great Ornian Rock, looking over the dry Plain of Ichala. Some say the vultures for which the rock is named once gathered here to feast on the bodies of those who died working the local salt mines.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_ES7_1}Jogurys
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_ES7_1}Jogurys lies on the flat western shores of Lake Tanaesis. This land was originally inhabited by nomadic tribes and has come under cultivation only recently. Imperial colonists have made intensive efforts to grow mullberry bushes here to raise silkworms, a lucrative product in this region.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_ES8_1}Chanopsis
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_ES8_1}Chanopsis sits near the headwaters of the Sethys River. Wheat grows well on the sun-baked slopes of the valley.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_ES1}Danustica
Settlement.text: {=xkkI7ejQ}The frontier city of Danustica has long defended the eastern reaches of the Empire, holding the line against incursions by the Aserai and various Darshi shahs and padishahs further to the east. Many an imperial legionary stationed here has scribbled graffiti on its walls cursing the city's sweltering summers, brackish water and mosquitos, but the inhabitants are proud of their role as border defenders and mock the soldiers wilting in the heat around them.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_ES1_2}Caira
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_ES1_1}Caira sits in the humid plains east of Danustica. Here, the sea air of the Perassic is trapped by the Calsean Hills, creating a climate shunned by many other Calradians. For those used to the heat, however, the rich soils provide a good living, and the villagers are proud of their role guarding the frontier with the Aserai.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_ES1_2}Polisia
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_ES1_2}Polisia sits on the eastern end of the Thymian Hills. Villagers harvest salt from pans in a shallow inlet to their south, near the town of Danustica. They prefer to live up in the hills, however, away from the thick and fetid air and the mosquitos of the coast.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_ES1_3}Tegresos
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_ES1_3}Tegresos sits amid woodland on the eastern end of the Thymian Hills, close to the Aserai and Khuzait domains. Originally it was settled in defiance of imperial authority by the bands of fugitives and adventurers known as the Eleftheroi, but the archons of Danustica eventually awarded this settlement a proper charter in exchange for helping to guard the frontiers.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_ES1_4}Erebulos
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_ES1_4}The frontier village of Erebulos sits in woodland beneath the Calsean Hills. This village was settled by Eleftheroi, though it has since been integrated into the archonate of Danustica. Villagers scoop clay from creek-bottoms here, and keep watch for Aserai and Khuzait raiders trying to infliltrate the imperial frontiers through the woods.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_ES2}Vostrum
Settlement.text: {=ytBRXqt8}Vostrum was founded by the Calradian mercenary Archacos, one of a number of rogue commanders who broke away from the Empire during its expansion. Unlike some, who tried to reproduce the Empire's republican heritage, he chose to rule as a god-king. His dynasty lasted for generations, until imperial troops overran it and smashed every haloed statue of Archacos and his successors into rubble. Even today, western and northern imperial senators accuse families from this region of being closet monarchists.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_ES5_2}Atphynia
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_ES2_1}The village of Atphynia lies in a valley in the Thymian Hills. The rocks here are speckled with sea-shells, while salt deposits lie in the valley, and villagers claim that this was once a bay of the sea uplifted by some great subterranean force.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_ES2_2}Gorcorys
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_ES2_2}Gorcorys sits on the Gorea, the southernmost tributary of the Sethys River. The dark, well-watered soil here makes this region an imperial breadbasket.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_ES2_3}Avalyps
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_ES2_3}Avalyps sits on the narrow but fertile shelf of land between the Perassic Sea and the Thymian Hills. The dark, well-watered soil here makes this region an imperial breadbasket.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_ES2_4}Alision
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_ES2_4}Alision lies in a nook of the Thymian Hills, north of the Perassic Sea. The rocks of this basin are lined with seashells, a long source of fascination to imperial philosophers who debate whether the earth experienced periodic inundations or if different portions are raised and lowered over time.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_ES3}Poros
Settlement.text: {=rGXdJybe}The town of Poros sits near the northern shores of the Perassic Sea. The warm rolling hills of these parts are well suited to the raising of sheep and horses. The herdsmen have a reputation for being proud and violent, but the nobles of the Leonipardes clan who rule this land are careful to respect their autonomy. Livestock rustling and blood feuds are common here, and it is said that the Leonipardes will never interfere unless invited by both parties, but when they do, their judgments will be obeyed by all.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_ES3_1}Canoros
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_ES3_1}Canoros sits in the plains north of the Perassic Sea. This land has been good horse country since even before the Empire came, furnishing the steeds of the Lycarean riders who routed several Calradian armies before their final defeat and absorption into the imperial cavalry.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_ES3_2}Tevea
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_ES3_2}Tevea sits by the banks of the River Sethys, south of the Ornian Rock. This great outcrop is named for the vultures who perch on its crags to keep watch on the hazy plains below. The low-lying riverlands are used by the villagers to grow flax.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_ES3_3}Zestea
Settlement.text: {=EaxhOE8Y}Zestea sits overlooking the Sethys River as it flows into the Perassic Sea. The conjoining of the waters makes for rich fishing grounds, for the shad and sardines who thrive in the brackish estuary waters as well as the tuna who come to eat them.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_ES4}Lycaron
Settlement.text: {=WGtzBswe}The natural fortress of Lycaron sits on a spur jutting out of the great Ornian rock. In the final years of the imperial conquest, the Palaic tribe here negotiated a peaceful federation with the Empire, only to see their home seized by the rebel leader Gethuz. The ensuing siege was only the first of many that Lycaron would undergo in the ensuing centuries, as its nearby silver mines made it a prize for every imperial pretender who ever tried to seize power in a civil war. It is said that the colony of vultures who inhabit the upper reaches of the Rock have dined on the flesh of every people of Calradia.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_ES4_1}Sagora
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_ES4_1}Sagora sits on a low ridge overlooking the River Sethys. This district is one of the rockier and less fertile parts of the river valley, but the valley scrub still supports the grazing of sheep.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_ES8_2}Popsia
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_ES4_2}Popsia lies on the eastern side of Mount Tarnea. Pelaic myth says that two gigantic brothers fought here and killed each other. Their sister Tarnea buried one in the depths of the Ophthys, the other in Lake Laconis, then transformed herself into the mountain to weep over their graves. Trees grow tall here in the cool shadows of the heights, and villagers harvest pines for sale as lumber.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_ES4_3}Canterion
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_ES4_3}Canterion lies by the Sethys River, between the Ornian Rock and the Thymian Hills. The rich grasses have made this land good horse country since even before the coming of the Empire, and today the village gives its name to the chargers prized by the imperial nobility.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_ES5}Onira
Settlement.text: {=4ENGzVaC}The tale of Sarpea of Onira is one of the epic poems of the eastern frontier. Like many, it seems written to justify the Empire's conquest. Sarpea, a senator's daughter, was seized by a Palaic chieftain and carried to his citadel here. When the imperial armies appeared before its walls years later to rescue her, she begged them to retreat for the sake of her infant son, whom her fearsome husband had threatened to hurl from the walls instead of allowing him to be captured and raised by his mother's people. The legions withdrew, so the story says, but the boy grew into a warrior who joined the Empire and slew his father. The town is now the main trading center for the herders and miners of the eastern Tanaetic plain.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_ES5_1}Lanthas
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_ES5_1}Lanthas is one of the few settlements on the wide but barren Tanaetic Plain. This scrubland is good sheep country, but in a frontier district scoured by imperial fugitives, wild Eleftheroi riders and steppe nomads, the villagers here have learned to watch their flocks closely.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_ES5_2}Lartusys
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_ES5_2}Lartusys lies on the eastern edge of the Tanaetic plain. The village sits near a deposit of salt, and salt springs occasionally bubble to the surface, feeding the legend that this was once a gateway to a haunted underground sea.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_ES5_3}Parasemnos
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_ES5_3}Parasemnos sits in a low pass linking the Tanaeitic plain with coastal lowlands near Danustica. Silver mines have long existed in the hills, although the deposits are no longer as rich as they once were, and the villagers must use closely-guarded secret methods to extract the precious metal.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_ES6}Phycaon
Settlement.text: {=RL2vacqv}Phycaon sits at the head of the Sethys valley, one of the main grain-producing regions of the central Empire. Once the largest of the Palaic cities, its leaders led a league of the tribes against imperial encroachment into the region. But when the Empire's victory looked inevitable, they made their peace. The population, now thoroughly Calradicized, have a reputation for being serious, respectable and trade-minded, dependable if a bit humorless.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_ES6_1}Saldannis
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_ES6_1}Saldannis lies beneath bluffs overlooking the River Sethys. The fine soil of the hills makes for a sticky clay when it washes down to the river, much prized by the potters of the imperial south.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_ES6_2}Spotia
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_ES6_2}Spotia lies east of the gently flowing Sethys River. The low rolling hills of this district comprise one of the breadbaskets of the Empire.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_ES6_2}Amycon
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_ES6_3}Amycon lies on a ridge between the dry Plain of Ichala and the Sethys valley. The people of this land are sheep herders, known for their dry, salty cheese flavored with cumin.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_ES7}Syronea
Settlement.text: {=UHvEEEBb}Syronea sits on the eastern shores of Lake Tanaesis. This city was once a byword for luxury and decadence. This was the center of the Empire's silk industry and an entrepot for the goods flowing in from what was known as Transtanaesia, the imperial possessions and protectorates beyond the great lake. But the coming of the Khuzaits ripped the Transtanaesia from the Empire's grasp and the Senatorial families of Syronea were forced to relearn the arts of war, dusting off old gilded armors and sharpening bejewelled swords to lead their followers against Urkhun's warriors.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_ES7_1}Psotai
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_ES7_1}Psotai sits on the western shores of Lake Tanaesis. The low-lying fields here are one of the major grain producing centers of the eastern frontier regions.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_ES7_2}Vargornis
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_ES7_2}Vargornis is a fishing village on Lake Tanaesis. Huge pike can sometimes be found in the lake's waters, along with more common perch and bream.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_ES7_2}Eunalica
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_ES7_3}Eunalica sits on the western shores of Lake Tanaesis. This low-lying country is fine land for the growing of flax.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_S1_1}Ustokol
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_S1_1}Ustokol sits on the windswept Kachyar Peninsula, between the Battanian and Byalic seas. Hardy northern cattle have been bred to eat the short grasses that grow among the rocks, supplemented by sea-kelp in hard times.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_S2_1}Mazhadan
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_S2_1}Mazhadan sits on the forested western shores of Lake Laconis. Villagers grow flax in the muddy valleys between the hills.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_S3_1}Nevyansk
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_S3_1}Nevyansk sits at the foot of a fortified outcrop that the Sturgians call Minador. The towers that stand today are used by the Sturgians to keep watch over the rich but vulnerable wheatfields in these borderlands. Beneath the Sturgian walls however are foundations laid when the fortress was known by its Battanian name, Mynad Rhyfel, the hill of war, and the Sturgians have no doubt that their neighbors to the west would very much like to take it back.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_S3_2}Dnin
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_S3_2}Dnin sits on pastures overlooking the great bay that the Sturgians call the Battanian Sea. Horses graze on the heights, glancing down occasionally at the trading longships and fishing boats passing beneath them.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_S4_1}Kranirog
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_S4_1}Kranirog sits near a ridge at the beginning of the Kachyar Peninsula. The villagers in these parts are expert trappers, hunting marten, fox and rabbit for the rich pelts much in demand in the south.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_S4_2}Ismilkorg
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_S4_2}Ismilkorg sits in the Irkaria hill country between Lake Laconis and the gulf that the Sturgians call the Battanian Sea. The people here are mostly cattle-herders as well as cattle-rustlers, and have long traded raids with the imperial frontier villages to the south and Battanians to the west.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_S5_1}Ov
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_S5_1}Ov is a recently settled Sturgian colony on the high wooded slopes over the Mazapor estuary. Sturgians came to this region in search of furs, but game has been driven further west into yet-unsettled lands and these days the residents raise flax in meadows amids the woods.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_S5_2}Ferkh
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_S5_2}Ferkh lies in a valley at the western edge of the Chertyg Mountains. It serves as a base for traders venturing further into the highlands, braving cold, wolves and the sometimes-hostile, sometimes-friendly peoples of the woods in pursuit of fur, the bounty of the northlands.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_S6_1}Takor
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_S6_1}Takor is a cattle-raising village in the heart of the Chertyg Mountains. The term 'Takorski' is used by other Sturgians to refer to someone whose speech is unintelligible. Above the village, small wisps of smoke show where wandering Vakken forest dwellers make their temporary fields, sowing them for one or two seasons before moving elsewhere.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_S7_1}Urikskala
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_S7_1}Urikskala sits on a bluff overlooking the eastern shores of Lake Laconis. The eastern edge of the lake is rich with fish, including massive pike and sturgeon that breed in the nearby Karakaz estuary.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_S8_1}Vladiv
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_S8_1}Vladiv lies on a plain to the northeast of Mount Iltan. The hardy cattle of this region have learned to dig through thick winter snows in search of grass to sustain them until the spring.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_S1}Varcheg
Settlement.text: {=i2VkRLBg}The former Nord colony of Varcheg sits on a windswept bluff at the base of the Kachyar Peninsula in what was once Battanian land. The jarl who founded this outpost, hoping to trade with the interior, pledged himself in fealty to the Battanian High King Dernmachad, but then proceeded to dabble in Battanian politics. Annoyed, Dernmachad hired a Sturgian army to crush his unreliable new vassal. The Sturgians complied and routed the Nords, but then demanded the newly captured town as their payment. They called the town 'Varcheg,' a corruption of the Nordic term for 'oathsworn companion,' to mock both rivals whose quarreling had handed them their prize.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_S1_1}Rodobas
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_S1_1}Rodobas, the house of Obas, is named for a long-dead Sturgian hill chieftain. Perched high on a ridge overlooking the rolling hills of Irkaria, it adjoins one of the few remaining virgin forests of this once-wild land. The village serves as a base for trappers looking for furs in the primeval gloom of the great trees.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_S2_2}Forin
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_S1_2}Forin sits on grassy downs overlooking a tributary of the Miron River, on the edge of the wild forests of eastern Irkaria. Landowners here have turned forest-land into pasture for horses.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_S1_3}Kargrev
Settlement.text: {=s7XNUFCD}Kargrev was once Car Gryff, the ringfort of the Battanian chief Gryff, but was conquered by the Sturgians two generations ago. Recently, the most intrepid of the villagers have joined Nords and others who go every summer to the far north, to Beinland and beyond, in search of walrus ivory.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_S2}Balgard
Settlement.text: {=Xom9DeXZ}Balgard, which sits on the icy waters of the Byalic Sea, was founded by migrants from the Nordvyg. Legend holds that the initial wave of Nords arrogantly demanded tribute from the nearby Vakken and Sturgian tribes, who formed an alliance and drove the newcomers back to their ships. But the victors fell out over the spoils, until a canny Nord, Gundar, landed and volunteered to help them fairly divvy up the weapons and armor of his dead kinsmen. The residents recognized Gundar's lordship over the region and his descendants, intermarried with the Sturgians, are today the grand princes of Sturgia.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_S2_1}Safna
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_S2_1}Safna in a valley in the rugged Chertyg Mountains. Villagers grow barley here, using it to make dumplings from the meat of mountain cattle that is sold in the markets of nearby towns.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_S2_2}Marabrot
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_S2_2}Marabrot sits on a high rocky ridge between the Mazapor Estuary and the Byalic Sea. This harsh land would probably not be settled where it not for the rich iron deposits in the hills.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_S6_2}Dvorusta
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_S2_3}Dvorusta is a fishing village on the northern shores of Lake Laconis. The water is cold and pure here, thanks to the streams running down from the Chernyg mountains, and the village fishermen take in a rich catch of freshwater lake fish.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_S3}Omor
Settlement.text: {=pbHXtJ82}Omor sits on the eastern shores of Lake Laconis. Long before the Sturgians formed themselves into a principality it was a holy site for the forest tribes, who worshipped their gods and ancestors in the sacred oak trees of the nearby woods. Today, it is an emporium for fur trappers and woodsmen, and the primeval peace of the forests is drowned out by the sounds of bartering, saws, and the unloading of ships at the lake.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_S3_1}Chornobas
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_S3_1}Chornobas, or Blackwood, sits in lands recently cleared from the forests in the hills of Irkaria. The villagers grow rye and barley to feed the booming port city of Omor. To the northeast, the lands for the most part remain wooded, although small wisps of smoke show where Sturgian settlers are beginning to cut down trees and sow fields.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_S3_2}Skorin
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_S3_2}Skorin lies in the heart of Irkaria, a patchwork of grassy downs and forests between the Battanian Sea and Lake Laconis. Villagers comb the remaining woods of these once-wild lands for signs of marten, mink, rabbit and other game, the fur of which is much valued by the merchants and magnates of northern Calradia.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_S4}Varnovapol
Settlement.text: {=aTMypBiY}Varnovapol, which sits beneath the Chertyg Mountains on the crystal waters of Lake Laconis, has the dubious honor of being perhaps the most-often conquered city in Calradia. Originally it was a colony of the Empire, infamous as a place of exile for dissident senators, before it was seized by Nords as a base to expand their influence into the Sturgian fur trade. It was taken by the Alkit tribe from the eastern steppe and briefly served as the capital of a small khanate, before finally falling to the fierce Ormidoving clan.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_S4_1}Borchovagorka
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_S4_1}Borchovagorka sits on a small rise on the steep northern shores of Lake Laconis. The village depends primarily on fishing, pulling perch, bream, salmon and occasionally large sturgeon and pike from the lake waters.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_S8_2}Glavstrom
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_S4_2}Glavstrom sits on the eastern shores of the Byalic Sea. The craggy shores here are thick with rockfish, which the villagers catch with nets despite the turbulence of the waters.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_S4_3}Omkany
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_S4_3}Omkany in the heart of the icy Chertyg Mountains. Villagers in this district raise hogs, curing their fat with salt and in garlic and selling it throughout the northlands.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_S4_4}Yangutum
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_S4_4}Yangutum sits in a nook of the Chertyg Mountains near the north shores of Lake Laconis. The foresters harvest oak, elm and other hardwoods from the mountainsides.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_S5}Tyal
Settlement.text: {=F5HlQdgf}Tyal sits atop a high valley that climbs Mount Iltan, a craggy peak in eastern Calradia named for a god of the steppe peoples. This region has long stood aloof from the power struggles of the other Sturgian principalities. Its people are known as wanderers, traders, horse breeders and fur-trappers. The local aristocracy has occasionally exchanged princesses with the steppe tribes to the east to firm up a truce or a trade pact, and proudly includes the names of several great khans on their list of ancestors.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_S5_1}Visibrot
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_S5_1}Visibrot is a sheep-rearing village on the lower slopes of Mount Iltan. Though this region is cold and remote, its importance as a trade juncture between Lakes Laconis and Tanaesis, between the Empire and the steppe, mean that it is relatively densely populated.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_S5_2}Bukits
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_S5_2}Bukits sits on the eastern slopes of Mount Iltan. Villagers raise highland cattle here, bred to withstand the icy gusts that tear down the mountain.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_S7_2}Alov
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_S5_3}Alov overlooks the Iltan portages, a series of crossings over the Karakaz and Davana rivers. Villagers cultivate rye and barley on slopes leading down to the river, and the rich black soil of the region compensates for the long winters and short growing season.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_S6}Sibir
Settlement.text: {=PPadNxa6}Sibir was founded on the seaward slopes of the Chertyg Mountains by Nordic traders, who wished a base to buy furs from the local Vakken-speaking foresters. As the Sturgian tribes became principalities, and elected chieftains evolved into boyars who demanded taxes and labor as their due, this region became a magnet for Sturgians who had little taste for deference. Today, the ambitious Isyaroving family governs this region, but they must always balance their hunger for wealth and men to fight their wars with their subjects' reluctance to provide it.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_S6_1}Kvol
Settlement.text: {=banXBv0D}The villagers of Kvol include the descendants of refugees and malcontents from across Calradia, seeking isolation in the cold northern forests. They grow barley for sustenance, but many far afield for seasonal work. Some join Nords and others on their walrus hunts in the far north.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_S6_2}Radakmed
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_S6_2}Radakmed sits on the coasts of the Byalic Sea. Many of the families in the region trace their roots to Nords who migrated south, or Vakken who gave up their nomadic lives in the woods. Whatever lands they may have come from, the people of Radakmed have now taken to the sea. Their wanderlust not yet slacked, they sail far to the north each summer to hunt walrus, for flesh to eat, ivory to trade, and blubber to light lamps on long winter nights.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_S6_3}Alebat
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_S6_3}Alebat sits deep in the forests of northeastern Sturgia. This isolated region has long been a refuge for those fleeing oppression or debt or bloodfeud across the northlands, and the dialect is strongly influenced by the tongue of the Vakken woodspeople.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_S7}Revyl
Settlement.text: {=T2E4xKVn}Revyl, chief town of the rocky Kachyar Peninsula, was a traditional rival of Balgard. According to legend the Balgardian princess Arkina, whose husband had been slain by the Revylians, accepted a proposal from her enemy's king to marry and settle the feud. On her wedding night, however, she barred the door of his hall and burned him and a hundred of his kinsmen and warriors alive inside. The feud has long since been settled by pacts and marriages with happier outcomes, although Revylians still resent the ascent of the Balgardian Gundaroving dynasty.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_S7_1}Korsyas
Settlement.text: {=Aa6Ug1hj}Korsyas sits on the bay that the Sturgians call the Battanian Sea. Villagers here specialize in hunting blackfish, minke and other smaller whales that breed here in the protected waters.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_S7_2}Karbur
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_S7_2}Karbur sits at a plateau on the Kachyar Peninsula. Sheltered somewhat by a high ridge to their north, the villagers here raise barley and grain.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_S1_2}Zhemyan
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_S7_3}Zhemyan lies on the ridge that forms the spine of the Kachyar Peninsula. The rich grassy fields of this region make it a prime spot for local landowners to raise horses.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_A1_1}Tubilis
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_A1_1}Tubilis lies on the Bay of Charas, which the Aserai call Shariz. Villagers go fishing here amid the offshore islands in search of tuna, sardines, and shark.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_A2_1}Sahel
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_A2_1}Sahel sits on the edge of the Bay of Qasira, beneath the red sandstone Jabal Ashabi mountains. This ridge catches rainclouds coming off the Bahr al-Yeshm sea and are brushed by monsoons from the southeast, allowing cistern-watered fields of flax.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_A2_2}Asmait
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_A2_2}Asmait lies in a nook of the red sandstone Jabal Ashabi mountains, bordered to the south by the deep desert. Villagers trap floods running down the hills during rare rainstorms, using the water to grow date palms and other crops.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_A3_1}Ain Baliq
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_A3_1}Ain Baliq is clustered around a well between the mesas of the Jarjara Escarpmen. The surrounding lands, though dry, produce enough grass in the spring to allow the breeding of horses.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_A3_2}Deir Hawa
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_A3_2}Deir Hawa sits perched on the slopes of a mesa in the Jarjara Escarpment. This windswept bluff was once a refuge for religious ascetics, but their isolation came to an abrupt end when one of the curious pilgrims who came to visit them spotted the gleam of silver in the surrounding rocks. Prospectors have long exhausted the richest veins, but the villagers who live here today practice a number of close-guarded techniques to extract the precious metal from the ores that remain.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_A4_1}Medeni
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_A4_1}Medeni sits in lowlands between the Bahr al-Yeshm sea and the Jarjara Escarpment. Villagers grow dates by the coast in gardens watered by wells and small dams in the wadis that trap run-off from the cliffs during the short rainy season.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_A4_2}Qidnar
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_A4_2}Qidnar sits on the landward side of the Jarjara Escarpment, looking down onto the deep desert of the central Nahasa. Here, the fierce rains that come once every few years fall onto rocky hills replete with clefts and crevaces, and can be diverted with channels into peaceful palm-gardens.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_A5_1}Jamayeh
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_A5_1}Jamayeh lies on the eastern end of the Jabal Minshar, a sharp sandstone ridge that runs parallel to the coast. Here the villagers grow olive trees overlooking the nearby Bay of Qasira.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_A6_1}Shibal Zumr
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_A6_1}Shibal Zumr lies where the Nahr al-Kals, the river of lime, comes down from the coastal hills to meet the Tiagys. Here the waters are pure and the soil is fertile, and grain is grown. But a short distance to the east, the land becomes barren and alkaline, and only the hardiest crops survive.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_A7_1}Uqba
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_A7_1}Uqba sits on the coastal plain of the Perassic Sea, which the Aserai call the Bahr al-Yeshm. Villagers trap rainwater and runoff from the hills to water their fields and their gardens of date-palms.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_A7_2}Bunqaz
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_A7_2}Bunqaz sits at the mouth of the wadi that divides the Jarjara Escarpment from the granite outcrop of the Jabal Tamar. Villagers sink wells here to tap the wadi's groundwater, using it to irrigate their olive groves.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_A8_1}Tamnuh
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_A8_1}Tamnuh lies near the southern end of the Jabal al-Kals, the bitter hills. The nearby castle guards the coastal land route between the Empire and the Aserai lands, a highway used by caravans and armies for thousands of years.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_A9_1}Barihal
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.castle_village_A9_1}The oasis-village of Barihal sits in a wadi between the mesas of the Jarjara Escarpment and the granite outcrop of the Jabal Tamar. The land is best known for the horses that are grazed on the desert's short-lived but rich spring grasses.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_A1}Quyaz
Settlement.text: {=1ImuW3My}Quyaz was once a mercantile republic that dominated the trade between the western ocean and the Perassic Sea, speaking the now all-but-extinct Kannic tongue, a relative of Nahasawi. But imperial hegemony slowly snuffed out its trade, and the rulers was taken over by mercenaries from the Nahasa. It came intermittently under imperial subjugation but today is a prized holding of the Banu Hulyan, a leading clan of the Aserai sultanate.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_A1_1}Tasheba
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_A1_1}Tasheba lies on the western edges of the Bahr al-Yeshm. Fishermen venture out into the protected waters, gentle and calm for most of the year, for tuna and sardines.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_A1_2}Baq
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_A1_2}Baq lies slightly inland from the Bahr al-Yeshm sea, beneath the great granite outcrop of the Jabal Tamar. The seawinds bring the uplands here just enough rain to support the cultivation of olive trees.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_A1_2}Fanab
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_A1_3}Fanab lies at the feet of the granite outcrop known as the Jabal Tamar, on the peninsula between the bay that the Aserai call the Bay of Shariz and the inner sea of the Bahr al-Yeshm. The seawinds bring just enough rain to support the cultivation of olive trees.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_A1_4}Hiblet
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_A1_4}Hiblet sits on the peninsula between the gulf that the Aserai call the Bay of Shariz, and the sea they call the Bahr al-Yeshm. The rainclouds that sweep across this land drop sufficient water to fill the village's cisterns and irrigate its date-palm gardens.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_A2}Husn Fulq
Settlement.text: {=bnl7Va4c}Husn Fulq, Fulq's citadel, stands at the landward side of the Jabal al-Kals, the hills of bitterness, that divide the Aserai lands from the Empire. Fulq, also known as Phalcos, was a dark-faced mercenary chieftain who came from lands far to the south. He founded a fortress here and then parlayed its strategic location into a fortune, taking bribes from the Empire and then from the Aserai to switch sides. After 20 years of playing both sides back and forth he sailed home in a ship laden with gold, but many clans of the Aserai proudly claim descent from him, and the 'Tricks of Fulq' are a staple of many a bazaar storyteller's repetoire.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_A6_2}Lamesa
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_A2_1}Lamesa sits amid open plains and patches of dry acacia forest on the eastern shores of the Bahr al-Yeshm. Some of the Aserai's most prized horses graze on the grasses of this district.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_A2_2}Abu Khih
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_A2_2}Abu Khih is the southernmost village of the Aserai sultanate in the valley of the Tiagys. The lands here are dotted with crumbling brick towers, the ruins of cities that once thrived here under the Darshi shahs, before steppe nomads came and broke the levees that tamed the river. Years of devastating floods, followed by famines, reduced the population of this land to a fraction of what it once was.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_A2_3}Hoqqa
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_A2_3}Hoqqa sits besides the meandering waters of the Tiyagis plain. Villagers grow crops close to the river, but the land quickly gives way to desert-steppe. Barren most of the year except for scrub, it is covered in grass and flowers in the spring and is fine grazing for horses.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_A3}Iyakis
Settlement.text: {=NFIYqaab}Iyakis sits in a cleft in the Jarjara escarpment, where the waters of the fierce but brief desert rains can be trapped and used for irrigation. For generations ago it was an autonomous outpost of the Empire known as Yachios, dominated by the Carasios clan. Fifty years ago however they saw the writing on the wall for imperial dominion in the southlands, and began intermarrying themselves with the tribes of the Nahasa. Today, known as the Qaraz, they take their places in the councils of the sultanate like any other family of the Aserai.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_A3_1}Abba
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_A3_1}Abba sits in a broad wadi of the Jarjara Escarpment, close to the outlet where the rains that fall once every few years rush down to the sea. Runoff from the hills is trapped underground here, sustaining an oasis. Wheat thrives in the fields and gardens.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_A5_2}Hunab
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_A3_2}Hunab lies in the Sahel al-Wuhush, the Plain of Beasts, weathered mesas of the Jarjara Escarpment. Although the name comes from the mysterious petroglyphs of animals found caved throughout the valley, it could just as well refer to the fine steeds reared today, fed on the lush if short-lasting crop of grass that covers the slopes in the spring.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_A3_3}Bir Seif
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_A3_3}Bir Seif is centered around a group of wells and pools in the Jarjara Escarpment. Villagers dig down to the shallow groundwater layer for clay to sell to the potters of the Nahasa.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_A4}Razih
Settlement.text: {=jXBnf2hQ}Razih is said to be the base from which Kannic explorers set forth to colonize the shores of the Perassic Sea in the centuries before the coming of the Empire, the prows of their ships decorated with the intertwined vine leaves of the Kannic goddess of wealth, wine, love and war. Today, the Kannic tongue has been replaced by Nahasawi dialects and their religion is all but forgotten, but the symbol lives on, said to protect those who risk all for the sake of gain or glory.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_A4_1}Qablab
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_A4_1}Qablab sits on a bluff of the rust-red Jabal Ashabi hills, overlooking the towers and harbor of Razih. Every morning, villagers leave the jasmine- and thyme-scented hills to descend to the thick air of the coast, where they harvest salt from artificial lagoons.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_A4_2}Mussum
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_A4_2}Mussum sits near the eastern coast of the Perassic Sea, which the Aserai call the Bahr al-Yeshm. Here, the deserts of the far south give way to desert-steppe with scattered acacia and scrub. The villagers here sink wells to water their groves of date palms.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.castle_village_A8_2}Kuqa
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_A4_3}Kuqa sits at the foot of a range of low hills east of the Bahr al-Yeshm sea, where the Aserai deserts give way to desert-steppe with scattered acacia and scrub. The villagers here sink wells to water their groves of date palms.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_A4_4}Doqa
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_A4_4}Doqa is a fishing village on the Bahr al-Yeshm sea. Villagers sail out in feluccas to harvest perch that sometimes grow as long as a man is tall, keeping an eye out for the salt-water crocodiles which live in the local inlets and marshes and which compete with them for their catch.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_A5}Hubyar
Settlement.text: {=IIMWPVhU}The inland city of Hubyar is said to be built on the ruins of a luxurious hunting lodge built by the decadent and cruel king Thuran, whom the patriarch Asera slew in vengeance for the enslavement of his family. This memory may explain the worldview of the fierce and austere Banu Qild, who hold the castle today and who detest all frivolity. But the scent of jasmine that can be detected on the night breezes here carries an undercurrent of temptation. It was here that the hero Nimr came to grief, caught in the chamber of a Banu Qild maiden and left hanging in a cage in the market until he perished.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_A5_1}Mahloul
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_A5_1}Mahloul in the Sahal al-Wuhush, the Plain of Beasts, that cuts through the Jarjara Escarpment south of the Bahr al-Yeshm. The valley takes its name from the mysterious petroglyphys of hoofed and horned animals carved on boulders scattered about. Groundwater provides just enough water to grow crops for subsistence, while the village makes its money from rearing horses on the rich grass that grows in clefts in the escarpment after the spring rains.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_A5_2}Liwas
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_A5_2}Liwas sits in the seaward end of the Sahal al-Wuhush, the Plain of Beasts. This broad valley runs between the Jabal Minshar, a sharp sandstone ridge near the coast, and the inland mesas of the Jarjara escarpment. Although the valleys name comes from the mysterious petroglyphs found here of horned and hoofed animals, it could just as well refer to the splendid horses that are grazed on the desert's short-lived but rich spring grasses.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_A5_3}Waltas
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_A5_3}Waltas sits by the Bay of Qasira, an inlet of the sea that the Aserai call the Bahr al-Yeshm. The ridges of the nearby Jabal Ashabi mountains catch rainclouds coming off the Bahr al-Yeshm sea, allowing for the growing of wheat.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.town_A6}Sanala
Settlement.text: {=uO4dxCl8}The port of Sanala is the gateway through which the grain of the lower Damar has flowed forth to feed a hungry world. The Empire's periodic advances south of the Perassic Sea have usually been aimed at seizing this strategic prize. Although the legions were long ago forced to retreat, Sanala remains among the most cosmopolitan cities in Calradia, filled with merchants from many lands bidding for the lowest bulk prices.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_A6_1}Mijayit
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_A6_1}Mijayit lies off of the estuary of the Damar river as it reaches the Bahr al-Yeshm sea. The rich silt deposits left by the river make this one of the most fertile regions and densely populated regions of the Aserai lands.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_A6_2}Hamoshawat
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_A6_2}Hamoshawat lies on the lower Damar river, just before it reaches the Bahr al-Yeshm sea. The rich silt deposits left by the river make this one of the most fertile regions of the Aserai lands.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_A6_3}Jahasim
Settlement.text: {=Settlements.Settlement.text.village_A6_3}Jahasim sits on the southern shore of the sea that the Aserai call the Bahr al-Yeshm. The warm waters abound in tuna, bonito, sardines, and other fish.

Settlement.name: {=Settlements.Settlement.name.village_A6_4}Nahlan
